fourlaws.confirm.first.one: As you prayed, did you receive Christ into your life? According to His promise in Revelation 3:20, where is Christ right now in relation to you?
fourlaws.confirm.first.question.five: Were you sincere when you invited Christ into your life?
fourlaws.confirm.first.question.four.wor: (Christ speaking): "Behold, I stand at the door and knock; if anyone hears My voice and opens the door, I will come in to him" (Revelation 3:20).
fourlaws.confirm.first.question.one: According to His promise in Revelation 3:20, where is Christ right now in relation to you?
fourlaws.confirm.first.question.six: According to His promise in Revelation 3:20, where is Christ right now in relation to you?
fourlaws.confirm.first.question.three.wo: (Christ speaking): "Behold, I stand at the door and knock; if anyone hears My voice and opens the door, I will come in to him" (Revelation 3:20).
fourlaws.confirm.first.question.two.word: (Christ speaking): "Behold, I stand at the door and knock; if anyone hears My voice and opens the door, I will come in to him" (Revelation 3:20).
fourlaws.confirm.first.two: Christ said that He would come into your life. Would He mislead you? Therefore, how do you know that God has answered your prayer? (The trustworthiness of God Himself and His Word, the Bible, in other words, God keeps His Promises).
fourlaws.confirm.main: How to Know That Christ Is in Your Life
fourlaws.confirm.second.one.title: The Bible Promises Eternal Life to All Who Receive Christ
fourlaws.confirm.second.question.five: How do you know you have the Son?
fourlaws.confirm.second.question.five.wo: "And the witness is this, that God has given us eternal life, and this life is in His Son. He who has the Son has the life; he who does not have the Son of God does not have life. These things I have written to you who believe in the name of the Son of God, in order that you may know that you have eternal life" (1 John 5:11-13).
fourlaws.confirm.second.question.four: If you have the Son what else do you have?
fourlaws.confirm.second.question.four.wo: "And the witness is this, that God has given us eternal life, and this life is in His Son. He who has the Son has the life; he who does not have the Son of God does not have life. These things I have written to you who believe in the name of the Son of God, in order that you may know that you have eternal life" (1 John 5:11-13).
fourlaws.confirm.second.question.one.wor: "And the witness is this, that God has given us eternal life, and this life is in His Son. He who has the Son has the life; he who does not have the Son of God does not have life. These things I have written to you who believe in the name of the Son of God, in order that you may know that you have eternal life" (1 John 5:11-13).
fourlaws.confirm.second.question.two.wor: "And the witness is this, that God has given us eternal life, and this life is in His Son. He who has the Son has the life; he who does not have the Son of God does not have life. These things I have written to you who believe in the name of the Son of God, in order that you may know that you have eternal life" (1 John 5:11-13).
fourlaws.confirm.second.words: "And the witness is this, that God has given us eternal life, and this life is in His Son. He who has the Son has the life; he who does not have the Son of God does not have life. These things I have written to you who believe in the name of the Son of God, in order that you may know that you have eternal life" (1 John 5:11-13).
fourlaws.confirm.third.one: Thank God often that Christ is in your life and that He will never leave you.
fourlaws.confirm.third.question.one: After you receive Christ personally, will He ever leave you?
fourlaws.confirm.third.question.two: Because Christ will never leave you, how many times do you need to invite Him to come into your life?
fourlaws.confirm.third.two.line1: You can know on the basis of His promise that Christ lives in you and that you have eternal life, from the very moment you invite Him in. He will not deceive you.
fourlaws.confirm.third.words: "...for He Himself has said I will never leave you, nor will I ever forsake you" (Hebrews 13:5)
fourlaws.feelings.one.line2: The promise of God's Word, the Bible, is our authority. Not our feelings. The Christian lives by faith (trust) in the trustworthiness of God Himself and His Word.
fourlaws.feelings.three: The train will run with or without a caboose. However, it would be useless to attempt to pull the train by the caboose. In the same way, we as Christians, do not depend on feelings or emotions, but we place our faith (trust) in the trustworthiness of God and the promises of His Word.
fourlaws.feelings.two: This train diagram illustrates the relationship between fact (God and His Word), faith (our trust in God and His Word), and feeling (the result of our faith and obedience) (John 14:21).
fourlaws.grace.five: 5. You began the great adventure for which God created you.
fourlaws.grace.five.words1: "The thief comes only to steal and kill and destroy; I came that they may have life, and have it abundantly."
fourlaws.grace.five.words2: "Therefore if anyone is in Christ, he is a new creature; the old things passed away; behold, new things have come."
fourlaws.grace.four.words: "Truly, truly, I say to you, he who hears My word, and believes Him who sent Me, has eternal life, and does not come into judgment, but has passed out of death into life."
fourlaws.grace.one.words1: "Behold, I stand at the door and knock; if anyone hears My voice and opens the door, I will come in to him and will dine with him, and he with Me."
fourlaws.grace.one.words2: "to whom God willed to make known what is the riches of the glory of this mystery among the Gentiles, which is Christ in you, the hope of glory."
fourlaws.grace.three: 3. You became a child of God.
fourlaws.grace.three.question1: What does this verse say you have become?
fourlaws.grace.three.question2: If you are Child of God and I am a child of God, what does that make us?
fourlaws.grace.three.words: "But as many as received Him, to them He gave the right to become children of God, even to those who believe in His name"
fourlaws.grace.title.line1: NOW THAT YOU HAVE RECEIVED CHRIST
fourlaws.grace.title.line2: The moment that you received Christ by faith, as an act of the will, many things happened, including the following:
fourlaws.grace.two.question1: What did God do with your sins?
fourlaws.grace.two.question2: How many of your sins did He forgive?
fourlaws.grace.two.words1: "in whom we have redemption, the forgiveness of sins."
fourlaws.grace.two.words2: "When you were dead in your transgressions and the uncircumcision of your flesh, He made you alive together with Him, having forgiven us all our transgressions"
fourlaws.grace.wrapup.one: Can you think of anything more wonderful that could happen to you than receiving Christ? Would you like to thank God in prayer right now for what He has done for you? By thanking God, you demonstrate your faith.
fourlaws.grace.wrapup.three: To enjoy your new life to the fullest...
fourlaws.grace.wrapup1.words: "in everything give thanks; for this is Godâ€™s will for you in Christ Jesus."
fourlaws.law1.one.content: "For God so loved the world, that He gave His only begotten Son, that whoever believes in Him should not perish, but have eternal life" (John 3:16).
fourlaws.law1.one.title: God's Love
fourlaws.law1.title: God LOVES you, and offers a wonderful PLAN for your life.
fourlaws.law1.two.content: (Christ speaking) "I came that they might have life, and might have it abundantly" (that it might be full and meaningful) (John 10:10).
fourlaws.law1.two.title: God's Plan
fourlaws.law1.wrapup: Why is it that most people are not experiencing the abundant life? Because...
fourlaws.law2.four: This diagram illustrates that God is holy and man is sinful. A great gulf separates the two. The arrows illustrate that man is continually trying to reach God and the abundant life through his own efforts, such as a good life, philosophy, or religion.
fourlaws.law2.one.content: "For all have sinned and fall short of the glory of God" (Romans 3:23).
fourlaws.law2.one.title: Man is Sinful
fourlaws.law2.three.content: "For the wages of sin is death" (spiritual separation from God) (Romans 6:23).
fourlaws.law2.three.title: Man is Separated
fourlaws.law2.title: Man is SINFUL and SEPARATED from God. Therefore, he cannot know and experience God's love and plan for his life.
fourlaws.law2.two: Man was created to have fellowship with God; but, because of his stubborn self-will, he chose to go his own independent way and fellowship with God was broken. This self-will, characterized by an attitude of active rebellion or passive indifference, is evidence of what the Bible calls sin.
fourlaws.law2.wrapup: The Third Law explains the only way to bridge this gulf...
fourlaws.law3.four: This diagram illustrates that God has bridged the gulf which separates us from God by sending His Son, Jesus Christ, to die on the cross in our place to pay the penalty for our sins.
fourlaws.law3.one.content: "But God demonstrates His own love toward us, in that while we were yet sinners, Christ died for us" (Romans 5:8).
fourlaws.law3.one.title: He Died in Our Place
fourlaws.law3.three.content: "Jesus said to him, 'I am the way, the truth, and the life; no one comes to the Father, but through Me'" (John 14:6).
fourlaws.law3.three.title: He is the Only Way to God
fourlaws.law3.title: Jesus Christ is God's ONLY provision for man's sin. Through Him you can know and experience God's love and plan for your life.
fourlaws.law3.two.content: "Christ died for our sins...He was buried...He was raised on the third day, according to the Scriptures...He appeared to Peter, then to the twelve. After that He appeared to more than five hundred..." (1 Corinthians 15:3-6).
fourlaws.law3.two.title: He Rose From the Dead
fourlaws.law3.wrapup: It is not enough just to know these three laws...
fourlaws.law4.five: Receiving Christ involves turning to God from self (repentance) and trusting Christ to come into our lives to forgive our sins and to make us the kinds of person He wants us to be. Just to agree intellectually that Jesus Christ is the Son of God and that He died on the cross for our sins is not enough. Nor is it enough to have an emotional experience. We receive Jesus Christ by faith, as an act of the will.
fourlaws.law4.four.content: (Christ speaking): "Behold, I stand at the door and knock; if anyone hears My voice and opens the door, I will come in to him" (Revelation 3:20).
fourlaws.law4.four.title: We Receive Christ by Personal Invitation
fourlaws.law4.greet.four: Which circle would you like to have represent your life?
fourlaws.law4.greet.one.line3: Interests are directed by self, often resulting in discord and frustration.
fourlaws.law4.greet.one.title: SELF-DIRECTED LIFE
fourlaws.law4.greet.three: Which circle best represents your life?
fourlaws.law4.greet.two.line1: Christ is in the life and on the throne
fourlaws.law4.greet.two.line3: Interests are directed by Christ, resulting in harmony with God's plan.
fourlaws.law4.greet.two.title: CHRIST-DIRECTED LIFE
fourlaws.law4.greet.zero: These two circles represent two kinds of lives:
fourlaws.law4.one.content: "But as many as received Him, to them He gave the right to become children of God, even to those who believe in his name" (John 1:12)
fourlaws.law4.one.title: We Must Receive Christ
fourlaws.law4.three: When We Receive Christ, We Experience a New Birth (Read John 3:1-8.)
fourlaws.law4.title: We must individually RECEIVE Jesus Christ as Savior and Lord; then we can know and experience God's love and plan for our lives.
fourlaws.law4.two.content: "For by grace you have been saved through faith; and that not of yourselves, it is the gift of God; not as a result of works, that no one should boast" (Ephesians 2:8,9).
fourlaws.law4.two.title: We Receive Christ Through Faith
fourlaws.law4.wrapup: The following explains how you can receive Christ:
fourlaws.law4.wrapup.prep: That's all right. But someday, you may want to invite Jesus Christ into your life. I would like to show you how to receive Jesus Christ when that day comes.
fourlaws.main: Have you Heard of the Four Spiritual Laws?
fourlaws.main.wrapup: Just as there are physical laws that govern the physical universe, so are there spiritual laws that govern your relationship with God.
fourlaws.prayer: "Lord Jesus, I need You. Thank You for dying on the cross for my sins. I open the door of my life and receive You as my Savior and Lord. Thank You for forgiving my sins and giving me eternal life. Take control of the throne of my life. Make me the kind of person You want me to be."
fourlaws.prayer.four: If it does, I invite you to pray this prayer right now, and Christ will come into your life, as He promised.
fourlaws.prayer.one.line1: YOU CAN RECEIVE CHRIST RIGHT NOW by FAITH THROUGH PRAYER. (Prayer is talking with God)
fourlaws.prayer.one.line2: God knows your heart and is not concerned with your words as He is with the attitude of your heart.
fourlaws.prayer.three: Does this prayer express the desire of your heart?
fourlaws.prayer.two: The following is a suggested prayer:
fourlaws.suggest.five: T. Trust God for every detail of your life.
fourlaws.suggest.five.words: "casting all your anxiety on Him, because He cares for you."
fourlaws.suggest.four: W. Witness for Christ by your life and words.
fourlaws.suggest.four.words1: And He said to them, "Follow Me, and I will make you fishers of men."
fourlaws.suggest.four.words2: "My Father is glorified by this, that you bear much fruit, and so prove to be My disciples."
fourlaws.suggest.one: G. Go to God in prayer daily.
fourlaws.suggest.one.words: "If you abide in Me, and My words abide in you, ask whatever you wish, and it will be done for you."
fourlaws.suggest.six: H. Holy Spirit- allow Him to control and empower your daily life and witness.
fourlaws.suggest.six.words1: "But I say, walk by the Spirit, and you will not carry out the desire of the flesh. For the flesh sets its desire against the Spirit, and the Spirit against the flesh; for these are in opposition to one another, so that you may not do the things that you please."
fourlaws.suggest.six.words2: "but you will receive power when the Holy Spirit has come upon you; and you shall be My witnesses both in Jerusalem, and in all Judea and Samaria, and even to the remotest part of the earth."
fourlaws.suggest.three: O. Obey God moment by moment.
fourlaws.suggest.three.words: "He who has My commandments and keeps them is the one who loves Me; and he who loves Me will be loved by My Father, and I will love him and will disclose Myself to him."
fourlaws.suggest.title.line2: Spiritual growth results from trusting Jesus Christ. "The righteous man shall live by faith" (Galatians 3:11). A life of faith will enable you to trust God increasingly with every detail of your life, and to practice the following:
fourlaws.suggest.two.suggestion: Begin with the Gospel of John.
fourlaws.suggest.two.words: "Now these were more noble-minded than those in Thessalonica, for they received the word with great eagerness, examining the Scriptures daily to see whether these things were so."
fourlaws.wrapup.one.line2: God's Word admonishes us not to forsake "the assembling of ourselves together" (Hebrews 10:25). Several logs burn brightly together; but put one aside on the cold hearth and the fire goes out. So it is with your relationship with other Christians. If you do not belong to a church, do not wait to be invited.
fourlaws.wrapup.one.words: "not abandoning our own meeting together, as is the habit of some people, but encouraging one another; and all the more as you see the day drawing near."
fourlaws.wrapup.three.line2: IF THIS CONTENT HAS BEEN MEANINGFUL AND HELPFUL TO YOU, PLEASE SHARE OR READ IT TO SOMEONE ELSE.
fourlaws.wrapup.two: Take the initiative; call or visit a nearby church where Christ is honored and His Word is preached. Start this week, and make plans to attend regularly.
